name: Colour TV Game MK 10 (model n? 01 / 4842)
language: 10 games : target 1, target 2, basket 1, basket 2, gridball, squash 1, squash 2, football, tennis, ice hockey
keyboard: Two detachable paddles with analog joystick and fire button
coprocessor: power on/off, speed slow/fast, player 1 bat size (large/small), player 2 bat size (large/small), service auto/manual
power: External power supply unit (Binatone mains adapter Model 02 / 5011)
description:
This pong is one of the many Binatone systems. As its name indicates, it offers 10 games : 8 pong games (basket 1, basket 2, gridball, squash 1, squash 2, football, tennis, ice hockey) and 2 shooting games (target 1, target 2). It is the last Binatone pong marketed and the most evoluated one.

Game selection is made through 10 individual push buttons. The two detachable controllers are composed of an analog joystick and a fire button. They can be stored in slide-in compartments located on both sides of the case. The shape of this plastic case is fairly common and many pongs can be found with the same design.

Interestingly enough, both shooting games are not played with a light gun but directly with the analog joysticks.

This system seems to be powered by a General Instruments AY-3-8610 chipset, which equiped a lot of other pong systems (anyone can confirm ?).

Here are some interesting promoting texts:
10 separate push buttons for game selection. Games include football, ice hockey, gridball, basketball solo, basketball, tennis, squash, squash solo, plus 2 built in remote control shooting games. 'Joystick' hand controls for X-Y movement. Automatic on-screen scoring. Scores colour keyed for each player. Built-in push button firing device for shooting games. Different authentic sounds for hit, rebound and score. Selectable fast and slow ball speeds for professional and amateur ratings. Bat sizes separately adjustable for left and right players allowing for handicap situations. Selectable auto and manual service. Suitable for use on most sizes and brands of colour or black and white UHF TVs.

advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> UK ADVERT (MAY 1980)</strong></font><br><blockquote>Advert says:<br><br> The ATOM -a definitive personal computer. Simple-to-build, simple-to-operate. But a really powerful full-facility computer. And designed on an expandable basis. You can buy a superb expanded package now-tailored to your needs. Or, you can buy just the standard Atom kit, and, as you grow in confidence and knowledge, add more chips. No need to replace your equipment. No need to worry that your investment will be overtaken by new technology. As you need more power, more facilities, you can add them! <br><br> <b>The standard ATOM kit includes:</b><br> . Full sized QWERTY keyboard. Rugged polystyrene case<br> . Fibreglass PCB. 2K RAM. 8K ROM. 23 integrated circuits . Full assembly instructions including tests for fault-finding. (Once built, connect it to any domestic TV and power source)<br> . Power requirement: 8V at 800 M A. ATOM power unit available.<br> PLUS FREE MANUAL written in two sections <br> - teach yourself BASIC and machine code for those with no knowledge of computers, and a reference section giving a complete description of the ATOM's facilities. All sections are fully illustrated with example programs.<br><br> <b>The ATOM concept</b><br> Adding chips into sockets on the PCB allows you to progress in affordable steps to large-scale expansion. You can see from the specifications that the RAM can be increased to 12K allowing high resolution (256 x 192) graphics. Two further ROM chips, e.g. maths functions, can be added directly to the board giving a 16K capacity. In addition to 5 I/O lines partly used by the cassette interface, an optional VIA device can provide varied I/O and timer functions and via a buffer device allow direct printer drive. An optional module provides red, green and blue signals for colour. An in-board connector strip takes the ATOM communications loop interface. Any number of ATOMs may be tinked to each other - or to a master system with mass storage, hard copy facility. Interface with other ACORN cards is simplicity itself. Anyone ACORN card may be fitted internally. So you can see there are a vast number of modular options and additions available, expanding with your ability and your budget.<br><br> <b>The ATOM hardware includes:</b><br> .Memory from 2K to 12K RAM on board (up to 35K in case)<br> .8K to 16K ROM (two 4K additions) 86502 processor<br> .Video Display allows high resolution (256 x 192) graphics and red, green and blue output<br> .Cassette Interface-CUTS 300 baud<br> .Loudspeaker allows tone generation of any frequency<br> .Channel36 UHF Modulator Output .Bus output includes internal connections for Acorn Eurocard.<br><br> <b>The ATOM software includes:</b><br> .32-bit arithmetic (+/- 2,000,000,000)<br> .High speed execution<br> .43 standard/extended BASIC commands <br> .Variable length strings (up to 256 characters)<br> .String manipulation functions<br> .27 32-bit integer variables<br> .27 additional arrays<br> .random number function .PUT and GET byte<br> .WAIT command for timing<br> .DO-UNTIL construction<br> .Logical operators (AND, OR, EX-OR)<br> .LINK to machine-code routines<br> .Plot draw and move. <p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Paul Durrant</b></p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> MBC-550 FRENCH ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>''The personal computer 550, an opened door upon you computing future''</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> GERMAN PROMOTIONAL PICTURE</strong></font><br><blockquote></blockquote>

The result: more performance, more quality, more reliability, and higher speed for greater throughput than ever before.<br> CPU 286 and CPU 16032 can upgrade present systems to state-of-the-art operation, or serve as powerful fundations for new systems. CPU 68K, aside from being a superd CPU board, is also the core of our system 816/68K.<br> As always, CompuPro kept an eye on the future in designing these CPUs. With a CompuPro, you don't shudder a fast-changing technology, you welcome it.<br><br> We give you brains and brawn in one box, and that's beautiful. </blockquote>

So you come first. In the office or at home.<br> The hardware gives you your choice of 8-bit or 16-bit processors, 5 1/4" or 8" disk drives and standard green or high resolution color monitor.<br> The software includes advanced, user friendly programs for all types of banking, accounting and business management. <br><font color="red"><strong>> GERMAN LEAFLET #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>"This flexibly expandable computer grows by the increase of business activities and the rising requirements."<br><br> A reliable office computer, which can flexibly adapt to the business work, as it is essential for the office to execute resulting works promptly, correctly, and precisely.<br> A user-friendly conceived EDP-system like the MZ-3541 is essential, particularly for small to medium sized companies.<br> The MZ-3541 contributes for a substantial increase of the productivity in the office by the assumption of routine works. SHARP has designed the new MZ-3541 in such a way that it can be used for the most diverse resulting office works. And because multiple peripheral devices are available, the system can grow dynamically with the business activities.<br><br> The MZ-3541 is the result of Sharp's extensive market study and ergonomics studies. The free mobile keyboard makes data input and the operation easier and allows for spatial conditions an adapted installation of the system possible.<br> Sharp's MZ-3541 - the complete system for the business data processing.      <p class="petitgris">Courtesy of <b>www.sharpmz.org</b></p></blockquote>
